intro: Lorentea haenkeana var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy lorentea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
